# textDidEndEditing(_:)

**Instance Method**

Posts a notification when the text is no longer in edit mode.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func textDidEndEditing(_ notification: Notification)
```

## Parameters

- **notification**: The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/textDidEndEditingNotification] to post to the default notification center.

## Discussion

After validating the new value, this method posts a [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/textDidEndEditingNotification] to the default notification center, which causes the text field’s delegate to receive a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/objectivec/nsobject/1428847-controltextdidendediting] message. This method then sends [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/endEditing(_:)] to the text field’s cell and handles the key that causes editing to end as follows:

- If the user ends editing by pressing Return, this method tries to send the text field’s action to its target. If unsuccessful, it sends [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/performKeyEquivalent(with:)] to its `NSView`, for example, to handle the default button on a panel. If that also fails, the text field selects its text.
- If the user ends editing by pressing Tab or Shift-Tab, the text field tries to have its `NSWindow` object select its next or previous key view, using the `NSWindow` method [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/selectKeyView(following:)] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/selectKeyView(preceding:)]. If unsuccessful, the text field selects its text.

See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl] for more information about the text delegate method.

## Implementing Delegate Methods

- **textShouldBeginEditing(_:)**: Requests permission to begin editing a text object.
- **textDidBeginEditing(_:)**: Posts a notification to the default notification center that the text is about to go into edit mode.
- **textDidChange(_:)**: Posts a notification when the text changes, and forwards the message to the text field’s cell if it responds.
- **textShouldEndEditing(_:)**: Performs validation on the text field’s new value.
